page.title: 155 CROSSES METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: This church (so called because 5 roads meet here) is also known as the "Sunshine Chapel" because the sunlight reflects from its yellow-gold brickwork. It holds two services each Sunday. Once monthly is Family Worship. A social committee organises a children's pantomime and 'housebound' party with other fund-raising events. 1985 was the church's centenary (it opened 10th Sept. 1885 at a cost of Â£1500 ). By 1900 a third of its income was through pew rents. In 1908 it gained an organ (Â£338), an organ blower was employed till electricity was installed in 1938. For the centenary, special occasions included a flower festival, garden party and barn-dance and a month with visiting preachers in September.
